analysis.Summary: Vue SFC that renders a card for an organization department, showing an edit icon, the department name (clickable for details), and a list of member user cards.
analysis.Purpose: Provide a reusable UI block to display a department’s basic info and members within an organization, with quick navigation to edit, detail, and member profile views.

Components.name: IconEdit
Components.responsibility: Render an edit icon inside a router-link to the department edit page.

Components.name: User
Components.responsibility: Render individual member cards with photo, name, position and click navigation to user profiles.

Functions.name: router-link :to
Functions.description: Generates a link to the department edit route.

Functions.name: h3 @click
Functions.description: On click, navigates to the department detail page using `$router.push`.

Functions.name: User @click
Functions.description: On click of a member card, navigates to that user’s profile.

analysis.Usage: Import and register the component in a parent view or another component, then use `<CardDepartment :department="deptObject" :organization="orgId" />` to render the department block.
Notes: Imports Spoiler and DepartmentSub but does not use them in the template—possibly leftover.
Scoped style defines a `.subdepartmentsartment` class that is never applied; likely a typo or dead CSS.
Props `department` and `organization` are both declared as Object; `organization` often used as an ID string/number.
Inline click handlers push full paths rather than named routes for detail/profile navigation.
